articles.author: NAJIB JOBAIN, SAMY MAGDY and BASSEM MROUE
articles.description: KHAN YOUNIS, Gaza Strip (AP) — The expected release of a second group of hostages held by Hamas in exchange for Palestinian prisoners held by Israel was delayed for hours Saturday as the militant group accused Israel of not complying with the deal's terms.
articles.title: Hamas says the second exchange of Israeli hostages for Palestinian prisoners is delayed

articles.author: JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — A container ship owned by an Israeli billionaire came under attack by a suspected Iranian drone in the Indian Ocean as Israel wages war on Hamas in the Gaza Strip, an American defense official said Saturday.
articles.title: An Israeli-owned ship was targeted in suspected Iranian attack in Indian Ocean, US official tells AP

articles.author: DAVID R. MARTIN and MICHAEL CASEY
articles.description: ELMSFORD, N.Y. (AP) — When Sean Rafferty got his start in the grocery business, anything that wasn't sold got tossed out.But on a recent day, Rafferty, the store manager for ShopRite of Elmsford-Greenburgh in New York, was preparing boxes of bread, donuts, fresh produce and dairy products to be picked up by a food bank.
articles.title: Tackling climate change and alleviating hunger: States recycle and donate food headed to landfills

articles.author: BILL BARROW and MEG KINNARD
articles.description: COLUMBIA, S.C. (AP) — Donald Trump is using a college football rivalry weekend to bask among his supporters in a state and region that are key to his presidential fortunes, while potentially upstaging his Republican opponent Nikki Haley on her home turf.
articles.title: Donald Trump will look to upstage Clemson grad Nikki Haley at her alma mater's football rivalry game

articles.author: SAMYA KULLAB
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russia on Saturday morning launched its most intense drone attack on Ukraine since the beginning of its full-scale invasion in 2022, targeting the Ukrainian capital, military officials said.
articles.title: Ukraine's military says Russia launched its largest drone attack since the start of the invasion

articles.author: LISA MASCARO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — As war and winter collide, a top adviser to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy acknowledged during a recent visit to Washington that the days ahead “will be tough” as his country battles Russia while U.S.
articles.title: The debate over Ukraine aid was already complicated. Then it became tangled up in US border security

articles.description: ROME (AP) — Pope Francis went to the hospital Saturday for tests after he came down with the flu, but the results ruled out any respiratory problems, the Vatican said.Francis, who had part of one lung removed as a young man, underwent a CAT scan, Vatican spokesman Matteo Bruni said.
articles.title: Pope Francis has a hospital checkup after coming down with the flu

articles.author: GIOVANNA DELL’ORTO
articles.description: ST. PAUL, Minn. (AP) — For the annual fall renewal of her shaman spirit, Mee Vang Yang will soon ritually redecorate the tall altar in her living room where she keeps her father’s ring-shaped shaman bells.
articles.title: In the US, Hmong 'new year' recalls ancestral spirits while teaching traditions to new generations

articles.author: ALEXA ST. JOHN
articles.description: The negative impact on the climate from passenger vehicles, which is considerable, could have dropped by more than 30% over the past decade if not for the world's appetite for large cars, a new report from the Global Fuel Economy Initiative suggests.
articles.title: Buyers worldwide go for bigger cars, erasing gains from cleaner tech. EVs would help

articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK
articles.description: Derek Chauvin, the former Minneapolis police officer convicted of murdering George Floyd, was stabbed by another inmate and seriously injured Friday at a federal prison in Arizona, a person familiar with the matter told The Associated Press.
articles.title: Ex-officer Derek Chauvin, convicted in George Floyd's killing, stabbed in prison, AP source says
